Key: ...*Gasp*!
What was I... doing right now?
I think... I was... Uh... That's right.

I am... a producer for a new idol. We're pushing
sales at the shopping district.
Um... Mr. Producer...
Hey, Origami. Sorry, I was in a daze.
Are you tired...?

No, I'm fine. It's a very important time for you
so I have to do a good job representing you.
Really?
Yeah. You're still new. We have to do our legwork.
U-Um... Producer? Um...

What's the matter, Origami? Is there some kind of
issue?
No... It's just, can I really be an idol?

What are you talking about? You're already a great
idol.

...Y-Yeah. But... it's not that. Um, I want to be
more visible, and become someone that
youths aspire to be.

Of course you can do that. Today we're just going
to go around the shopping district, but someday
you're going to fill the big stadiums.
...That sounds like a dream.

Dream... That's right. A big dream. And we're
working hard now to make it come true. Right?
Yeah.

I like your answer. So let's do another good job
today.

Okay... Producer. I'm sure you will take me
there... To the big stage.

Yeah, leave it to me. So let's change into today's
outfit.
Okay. Oh...
What's the matter?
Um, Mr. Producer? This outfit...

Huh? It should fit you perfectly. Is there a hole
in it or something?

No. But this outfit... wouldn't you say it's a bit
too flashy for singing in a shopping district?

Flashy? Really? Well, I think idols can be a bit
flashy.

Shid... I mean Mr. Producer... Do you like this
outfit?
Yeah. I'm sure you'll look good in it, Origami.
I see. Then fine. I'll do my best wearing it.

All right. Then let's get changed and go to the
shopping district. We'll do a live street
performance today.
(The concert started.)
(But no one is stopping to listen.)
(Hmm... This isn't good.)

(What should I do? At this rate, no one's even
going to remember her name.)
(Okay, we're going to need a strategy meeting.)
Origami, let's take a break.
What's the matter?
You changed already?!

Well, whatever... Anyways, we're doing a concert
and I wanted more people to stop and listen.
What should I do so more people will listen?
Hmm. Well...
It's important to smile.
Posing is important.
Being problematic is important.

What's important is to smile. I think your
expression is too stiff, Origami.
Smile... That's very difficult for me.

You're an idol, Origami. You can't be saying
things like that. You want to have your big
break, right?
Yes.
Okay, then.

I want to become famous and have the tabloids
report suspicious relations with you, and then I
want to have a surprise wedding.

U-Uh.... I think that's best left as a dream.
Yeah. Let's forget about the future. First
we need your smile to be softer.
How can my smile soften?
Hmm. Imagine something fun.
Something... fun?

That's right. If you think of fun things,
it'll give you a natural smile.
Okay. I'll give it a try.
All right. Show me your smile.
*Pant, pant*...
H-Hey... You're acting weird.
Shido... You can't do that... here... Ah...
STOP! STOPPPP!
What's the matter?
Weren't you acting a little crazy just now?
No. I was just imagining something fun.
Fun... That didn't sound right.
It was truly exciting.

Well yeah, I guess excitement's a part of it,
but... Don't you have any fun that's more
heartwarming?
I guess I understand the concept.

No, you should know. Like, being on the big stage.
Imagine yourself fulfilling your dream. That kind
of stuff.
Okay. I'll give it a try.
All right, now smile for me.
Okay.
...What do you think?

What do you mean...? Don't tell me you were
smiling just now.
I was.
What?! It looked like your usual expression.

That's not true. That was a 2 kilowatt smile.
Emotionally.
Hmm... Can you do it one more time?
It's a piece of cake.
...Are you smiling?
The biggest smile I have.
O-Okay.
Is this not good?

Hm. L-Let's hope for the best when you're up. Once
you start singing, your expression should soften.
You're good when it's the real thing, right?
It'll be fine. No problem.
O-Okay. Then let's do it again.

All right. There are more people here
than earlier.
(One more push.)
Origami, smile. Don't forget to smile.
L-Like this?

Good job. You're able to smile.
That's cute, Origami.

Hmm. What an idol needs is a good pose. Let's come
up with something striking.
What should I do?
Hmm. Do you have any pose you're good at?
I actually do. The best one.
Nice. Then let me see it.
Okay. I'm a bit embarrassed but... watch.
Hm? Oh? You're going to sleep on the floor...?
My best pose...

O-Okay... I don't think we can show
people that pose.

I'm embarrassed, too... but if you tell me to do
it, I will.
No, okay. Um, let's stand for now.
You didn't like it?

I think it's too avant-garde. Isn't there anything
else?
Yes, but this one was the most appropriate.

Okay, let's change it up, then! No posing! Let's
think of something else.
I see. Fine.

If a pose isn't good, how about a catchphrase?
Something that stands out and shows your
characteristics.
So I should change how I talk?

That's right. Why don't we start with something
easy and try to end on an interesting note?
Like dis? I got dis.
Um... Hm... Dis, huh?
Is it not cute like dis?

It's... super iffy... but maybe it could
be refreshing!
You like this like dis?
All right, let's give it a go.

E-Everyone. Thank you for gathering
around like dis...

(All right. Not many people around, but people
seem to like it.)

Good job, Origami. All you have to do is smile and
be friendly to the audience.
I-I got dis.
Good job. They're laughing.

(Huh...? Are we supposed to have people laugh at
an idol concert?)
(W-Well... I guess it's good enough for today.)

Being a little problematic is important. Although
you're an idol, you shouldn't forget your heart as
a rocker.
Heart as a rocker?

Yeah. The rocker movement of going against the
societal norm. You're going to rebel against the
system and grip the hearts of youths everywhere.

Roger. I'm going to read biker magazines, even
though I don't have my license yet.
Good good, that makes you so rebellious.

I'm going to buy a wooden sword at my
school retreat.
All right, do more.

I'm going to wear red and purple T-shirts under my
school uniform.
What a bad girl!
I'm going to sneak a butter knife into my pocket.
Crazy! Super crazy, Origami-san!
Am I going to get my big break?

Yeah, this is going to make you super popular...
Well, probably not...

(I was just going with the flow... but to be
honest, I feel like she's gotten a bit off-track.)

So... then I have no choice but to use my ace in
the hole.
You have an idea?

A photo of me being caught going to a hotel with
my producer. I used photo-editing software to
make it. This is bad. Super tabloid-worthy.
Wait... That'll end your life as an idol.

We can make it an established fact. It'll also
allow me to get married and quit.

You don't have to do that! You're barely popular
still. You shouldn't be thinking of quitting yet.
Being put straight like this hurts my feelings.
S-Sorry.

But this isn't good. Then we have no other choice
but to work hard.
Yeah... how troublesome.

Hey, wait... No, you should be working hard!
You're supposed to set the groundwork. That
in the end is the fastest way.
I see. Then I'm going to do my performance now.
Okay... yeah. That's the best way. Let's go.

(*Sigh*... Looking around, we're slowly but surely
gathering an audience.)

(We're on the right track. Keep this up, and
someday you'll end up being a top idol, Origami.)

Good job, Origami. You're an idol, so remember to
smile.
Okay, Mr. Producer.
Good smile, Origami. Let's keep up the good work.

(That's right. We've just started. We're going to
walk down the long, grueling path to stardom...!)
